children.text:
If you are a new user or experiencing difficulties, we strongly recommend reading the FAQ first. You can view it by tapping on the corresponding button in the bottom right corner of the screen.

To switch between landscape and portrait modes, use the "Orientation" button under the Options menu. The screen orientation will be restored the next time you start SpeedView. If you would like to enable auto-rotation, you can find this option in the app's settings.

To switch to the Compass mode, tap on the linear compass. To enter the HUD mode, tap anywhere on the speedometer area. To open the Advanced screen, tap on the speed graph. You can find the corresponding buttons if you open the Options menu and select Dashboard. To return to the default screen while in the Compass or HUD mode, tap anywhere on that screen or use the Back button.

To reset the distance traveled, enable speed warning or track logging, or to change indicator views, tap on the corresponding field.

To quickly switch between speed limits, long-tap anywhere on one of the main dashboards (excluding Advanced). When done, long-tap anywhere on that screen (or use the Back button) to confirm your changes and return to the previous dashboard.

To quickly access the app's preferences, long-tap on the speed graph. To change display units and other preferences, tap on the Settings menu item.

If you want to use this app without a GPS connection, tap anywhere on the Startup screen to skip it. Note that you can pause the recording of the GPS data anytime by going to the Advanced dashboard, then tapping on the "Stop recording" button.

In case you are experiencing an erratic speed issue or the program freezes after acquiring a GPS fix, try setting the minimum accuracy value to 50 meters to ignore most inaccurate data.

If there are any other problems, please do not hesitate to submit a ticket or contact us directly at speedview@codesector.com.
